properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis-firehose.access-key
properties.description: Amazon AWS Access Key

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis-firehose.amazon-kinesis-firehose-client
properties.description: Amazon Kinesis Firehose client to use for all requests for this endpoint. The option is a software.amazon.awssdk.services.firehose.FirehoseClient type.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis-firehose.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis-firehose.cbor-enabled
properties.description: This option will set the CBOR_ENABLED property during the execution

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis-firehose.configuration
properties.description: Component configuration. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.aws2.firehose.KinesisFirehose2Configuration type.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis-firehose.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the aws2-kinesis-firehose component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis-firehose.lazy-start-producer
properties.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis-firehose.operation
properties.description: The operation to do in case the user don't want to send only a record

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis-firehose.override-endpoint
properties.description: Set the need for overriding the endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with uriEndpointOverride option

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis-firehose.profile-credentials-name
properties.description: If using a profile credentials provider this parameter will set the profile name.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis-firehose.proxy-host
properties.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the Kinesis Firehose client

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis-firehose.proxy-port
properties.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the Kinesis Firehose client

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis-firehose.proxy-protocol
properties.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the Kinesis Firehose client

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis-firehose.region
properties.description: The region in which Kinesis Firehose client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1) You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis-firehose.secret-key
properties.description: Amazon AWS Secret Key

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis-firehose.session-token
properties.description: Amazon AWS Session Token used when the user needs to assume a IAM role

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis-firehose.trust-all-certificates
properties.description: If we want to trust all certificates in case of overriding the endpoint

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis-firehose.uri-endpoint-override
properties.description: Set the overriding uri endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with overrideEndpoint option

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis-firehose.use-default-credentials-provider
properties.description: Set whether the Kinesis Firehose client should expect to load credentials through a default credentials provider or to expect static credentials to be passed in.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis-firehose.use-profile-credentials-provider
properties.description: Set whether the Kinesis Firehose client should expect to load credentials through a profile credentials provider.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis-firehose.use-session-credentials
properties.description: Set whether the Kinesis Firehose client should expect to use Session Credentials. This is useful in situation in which the user needs to assume a IAM role for doing operations in Kinesis Firehose.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.access-key
properties.description: Amazon AWS Access Key

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.amazon-kinesis-client
properties.description: Amazon Kinesis client to use for all requests for this endpoint. The option is a software.amazon.awssdk.services.kinesis.KinesisClient type.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.async-client
properties.description: If we want to a KinesisAsyncClient instance set it to true

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.bridge-error-handler
properties.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions (if possible) occurred while the Camel consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. Important: This is only possible if the 3rd party component allows Camel to be alerted if an exception was thrown. Some components handle this internally only, and therefore bridgeErrorHandler is not possible. In other situations we may improve the Camel component to hook into the 3rd party component and make this possible for future releases. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.cbor-enabled
properties.description: This option will set the CBOR_ENABLED property during the execution

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.cloud-watch-async-client
properties.description: If we want to a KCL Consumer, we can pass an instance of CloudWatchAsyncClient. The option is a software.amazon.awssdk.services.cloudwatch.CloudWatchAsyncClient type.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.configuration
properties.description: Component configuration. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.aws2.kinesis.Kinesis2Configuration type.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.dynamo-db-async-client
properties.description: If we want to a KCL Consumer, we can pass an instance of DynamoDbAsyncClient. The option is a software.amazon.awssdk.services.dynamodb.DynamoDbAsyncClient type.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the aws2-kinesis component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.health-check-consumer-enabled
properties.description: Used for enabling or disabling all consumer based health checks from this component

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.health-check-producer-enabled
properties.description: Used for enabling or disabling all producer based health checks from this component. Notice: Camel has by default disabled all producer based health-checks. You can turn on producer checks globally by setting camel.health.producersEnabled=true.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.iterator-type
properties.description: Defines where in the Kinesis stream to start getting records

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.kcl-disable-cloudwatch-metrics-export
properties.description: If we want to use a KCL Consumer and disable the CloudWatch Metrics Export

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.lazy-start-producer
properties.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.max-results-per-request
properties.description: Maximum number of records that will be fetched in each poll

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.override-endpoint
properties.description: Set the need for overriding the endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with uriEndpointOverride option

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.profile-credentials-name
properties.description: If using a profile credentials provider this parameter will set the profile name.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.proxy-host
properties.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the Kinesis client

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.proxy-port
properties.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the Kinesis client

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.proxy-protocol
properties.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the Kinesis client

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.region
properties.description: The region in which Kinesis Firehose client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1) You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.secret-key
properties.description: Amazon AWS Secret Key

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.sequence-number
properties.description: The sequence number to start polling from. Required if iteratorType is set to AFTER_SEQUENCE_NUMBER or AT_SEQUENCE_NUMBER

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.session-token
properties.description: Amazon AWS Session Token used when the user needs to assume a IAM role

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.shard-closed
properties.description: Define what will be the behavior in case of shard closed. Possible value are ignore, silent and fail. In case of ignore a WARN message will be logged once and the consumer will not process new messages until restarted,in case of silent there will be no logging and the consumer will not process new messages until restarted,in case of fail a ReachedClosedStateException will be thrown

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.shard-id
properties.description: Defines which shardId in the Kinesis stream to get records from

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.shard-monitor-interval
properties.description: The interval in milliseconds to wait between shard polling

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.trust-all-certificates
properties.description: If we want to trust all certificates in case of overriding the endpoint

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.uri-endpoint-override
properties.description: Set the overriding uri endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with overrideEndpoint option

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.use-default-credentials-provider
properties.description: Set whether the Kinesis client should expect to load credentials through a default credentials provider or to expect static credentials to be passed in.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.use-kcl-consumers
properties.description: If we want to a KCL Consumer set it to true

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.use-profile-credentials-provider
properties.description: Set whether the Kinesis client should expect to load credentials through a profile credentials provider.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.use-session-credentials
properties.description: Set whether the Kinesis client should expect to use Session Credentials. This is useful in situation in which the user needs to assume a IAM role for doing operations in Kinesis.
